root.publications: Wald, Benji. 1994. Sub-Saharan Africa. In R. E. Asher & Christopher Moseley (eds.), Atlas of the World's Languages, 1 edn., 299-374. London: Routledge. ISBN 0415019257

child.publications: Wald, Benji. 1994. Sub-Saharan Africa. In R. E. Asher & Christopher Moseley (eds.), Atlas of the World's Languages, 1 edn., 299-374. London: Routledge. ISBN 0415019257
child.pub-comments: Wald states that the Masa languages "are contiguous, giving the appearance of a dialect continuum." He also states that Masa is thought by some to be a sub-group of Biu-Mandara.
